bill_title: to permit borrowing between school district funds.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to permit borrowing between school district funds. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 13-16-26 be amended to read as follows: 13-16-26. All or any part of a surplus of any school district fund, except the capital outlay fund provided by § § 13-16-6 to 13-16-9, inclusive, and the special education fund provided by § 13-37-16 may be transferred to any other school district fund. However, any unused portion of money that has been transferred into the special education fund may be transferred from the special education fund within the current fiscal year to the fund from which it originated. All or any part of any school district fund may be loaned to any other school district fund for a term not to exceed twenty-four months. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to permit a political subdivision to loan all or any portion of a fund to another fund under certain conditions. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. A political subdivision may loan all or any portion of a fund, not otherwise obligated, to another fund of that political subdivision for a term not to exceed five years. If money is loaned from one fund to another fund, the repayment to the original fund may not include any payment of interest, fees, or other charges. BILL HISTORY 1/20/98 First read in Senate and referred to Education. S.J. 120 1/26/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/26/98 Education Deferred to another day. 1/28/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/4/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/4/98 Education Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 7, NAYS 0. S.J. 320

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to permit a political subdivision to loan all or any portion of a fund to another fund under certain conditions. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. A political subdivision may loan all or any portion of a fund, not otherwise obligated, to another fund of that political subdivision for a term not to exceed fifteen years. If money is loaned from one fund to another fund, the repayment to the original fund may include interest, fees, or other charges not to exceed the current prime interest rate established by the Federal Reserve Board, at the time of the transfer of the loan. BILL HISTORY 1/20/98 First read in Senate and referred to Education. S.J. 120 1/26/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/26/98 Education Deferred to another day. 1/28/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/4/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/4/98 Education Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 7, NAYS 0. S.J. 320 2/5/98 Education Hog Housed. 2/6/98 Senate Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 26, NAYS 7. S.J. 368 2/9/98 First read in House and referred to Education. H.J. 460 2/12/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/12/98 Education Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 10, NAYS 2. H.J. 599

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to permit a political subdivision to loan all or any portion of a fund to another fund under certain conditions. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. A political subdivision may loan all or any portion of a fund, not otherwise obligated, to another fund of that political subdivision for a term not to exceed one year. If money is loaned from one fund to another fund, the repayment to the original fund may include interest, fees, or other charges not to exceed the current prime interest rate established by the Federal Reserve Board, at the time of the repayment of the loan. BILL HISTORY 1/20/98 First read in Senate and referred to Education. FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to permit borrowing between school district funds. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 13-16-26 be amended to read as follows: 13-16-26. All or any part of a surplus of any school district fund, except the capital outlay fund provided by § § 13-16-6 to 13-16-9, inclusive, and the special education fund provided by § 13-37-16 may be transferred to any other school district fund. However, any unused portion of money that has been transferred into the special education fund may be transferred from the special education fund within the current fiscal year to the fund from which it originated. All or any part of any school district fund may be loaned to any other school district fund for a term not to exceed twenty-four months.
